title: USGS Responds to Record Floods after Hurricane Irene

und.value:
Map of real-time streamflow
Rivers and streams are reaching record levels as a result of Hurricane Ireneâs rainfall, with more than 80 USGS streamgages measuring record peaks. USGS scientists are measuring streamflow and river levels, and repairing and installing streamgages. Crews continue to collect and analyze storm surge data from Hurricane Irene and document coastal erosion impacts. Other crews are out sampling water for pesticides, E. coli, nutrients, and sediment to document water quality impacts in areas affected by the hurricane.
